description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5p5gc","text":"The Oxford Nanopore Ligation Sequencing Kit is a versatile tool for generating long-read sequencing data across a wide range of organisms. This protocol outlines the general steps for library preparation and sequencing, with specific considerations for different sample types and the option for duplex sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"47bin","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"afd2f","text":"The kit is designed to prepare high molecular weight DNA for nanopore sequencing, capable of generating read lengths from a few kilobases to over 100 kilobases. The main steps include DNA repair, end-prep, adapter ligation, and clean-up, followed by loading onto a flow cell for sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"61h1f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8bml","text":"A key feature of this kit is its compatibility with duplex sequencing. Duplex sequencing involves reading both strands (template and complement) of a single DNA molecule through the same nanopore. This technique significantly improves sequencing accuracy, potentially reaching Q30 (99.9%) for a single double-stranded DNA molecule. To optimize for duplex sequencing, ensure successful ligation of sequencing adapters to both ends of the DNA strands and aim for a flow cell loading of 10-20 fmols.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We are still developing and optimizing this protocol

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"aku43","text":"Before you begin, you must ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"39aju","text":"1. Extract DNA using kit of your choice, check for quality using Tapestation and Qubit","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3nhfl","text":"2. Check kit has all equipment and reagents. Also check for any reagents required that do not come in the   Ligation Sequencing Kit","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ei47p","text":"3. Check that you flow cell has the correct number of available pores for quality sequencing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7e0i7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ce2l9","text":"Main Steps:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bb0fn","text":"Library Prep:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2tpb5","text":"1.  DNA repair and end-prep - 35 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1tmmv","text":"2. Adapter ligation and clean-up - 20 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5thur","text":"3. Priming and loading the flow cell - 5 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"crmsp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bshdr","text":"Sequencing and Data Analysis:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e2i16","text":"1. Basecalling","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"brcul","text":"2. Flow cell reuse","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6siq","text":"3. Downstream Analysis and Bioinformatics","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Prepare the NEB reagents in accordance with manufacturer’s instructions, and place on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dgtrj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eipm1","text":"2. In a 0.2 ml thin-walled PCR tube, mix the following:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ak9c","text":"Between each addition, pipette mix 10-20 times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8a9al","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7qu9v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","4_0":"","4_1":"","5_0":"","5_1":""},"colTitles":["Reagent","Volume"],"colWidths":[100,100],"data":[["DNA ","47 µl"],["NEBNext FFPE DNA Repair Buffer v2","7 µl"],["NEBNext FFPE DNA Repair Mix","2 µl"],["Ultra II End-prep Enzyme Mix","3 µl"],["\u003cstrong style=\"box-sizing: border-box; {"blocks":[{"key":"206n","text":"The Oxford Nanopore Ligation Sequencing Kit is a versatile tool for generating long-read sequencing data across a wide range of organisms. This protocol outlines the general steps for library preparation and sequencing, with specific considerations for different sample types and the option for duplex sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4qd9i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ca5cs","text":"The kit is designed to prepare high molecular weight DNA for nanopore sequencing, capable of generating read lengths from a few kilobases to over 100 kilobases. The main steps include DNA repair, end-prep, adapter ligation, and clean-up, followed by loading onto a flow cell for sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6e31h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9dgtd","text":"A key feature of this kit is its compatibility with duplex sequencing. Duplex sequencing involves reading both strands (template and complement) of a single DNA molecule through the same nanopore. This technique significantly improves sequencing accuracy, potentially reaching Q30 (99.9%) for a single double-stranded DNA molecule. To optimize for duplex sequencing, ensure successful ligation of sequencing adapters to both ends of the DNA strands and aim for a flow cell loading of 10-20 fmols.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8uvec","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d0psv","text":"When working with different sample types, consider the following:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1k0ft","text":"For animal samples:","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"rgp1","text":"Use gentle extraction methods to preserve DNA integrity","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d4kg6","text":"Consider using nuclease inhibitors if working with tissue samples","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fua5m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3iqip","text":" 2. For plant samples:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ek8lh","text":"Pay special attention to removing polysaccharides and secondary metabolites during DNA extraction","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bn0fe","text":"Use CTAB-based or specialized plant DNA extraction kits","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4tbh0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"707ps","text":" 3. For cellular samples (e.g., bacteria, cell cultures):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ciq7e","text":"Optimize lysis conditions to maximize DNA yield while minimizing shearing","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bd7i6","text":"For gram-positive bacteria, enzymatic pre-treatment may be necessary","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e0cd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8er6a","text":"Regardless of the sample type, the key to successful long-read sequencing is starting with high-quality, high molecular weight DNA. Avoid excessive pipetting or vortexing throughout the protocol unless stated to maintain DNA integrity.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aus44","text":"
  Giolai, M., Paajanen, P., Verweij, W., Witek, K., Jones, J. D. G., & Clark, M. D. (2017). Comparative analysis of targeted long read sequencing approaches for characterization of a plant’s immune receptor repertoire. BMC Genomics, 18(1), 564. https://doi.org/10.1186/s12864-017-3936-7

  
  Jain, M., Koren, S., Miga, K. H., Quick, J., Rand, A. C., Sasani, T. A., Tyson, J. R., Beggs, A. D., Dilthey, A. T., Fiddes, I. T., Malla, S., Marriott, H., Nieto, T., O’Grady, J., Olsen, H. E., Pedersen, B. S., Rhie, A., Richardson, H., Quinlan, A. R., … Loose, M. (2018). Nanopore sequencing and assembly of a human genome with ultra-long reads. Nature Biotechnology, 36(4), 338–345. https://doi.org/10.1038/nbt.4060

  
  Wang, Y., Zhao, Y., Bollas, A., Wang, Y., & Au, K. F. (2021). Nanopore sequencing technology, bioinformatics and applications. Nature Biotechnology, 39(11), 1348–1365. https://doi.org/10.1038/s41587-021-01108-x
